Oh my gosh, I just found out that my ex-husband is going to be the guest speaker at my daughter's school event next week!
Really? That must have been an unexpected surprise for you. How do you feel about it?

At first, I was shocked. I didn't think he would agree to do something like this. But now, I'm starting to feel a little uneasy about it. I mean, we've been divorced for years and I don't really want him to be a part of our lives anymore.
I can understand why you would feel anxious about that. It's important to consider your own feelings and boundaries in situations like this. Have you talked to your daughter about how you feel?

No, I haven't yet. I didn't want to ruin her excitement about the event. But I just can't help feeling angry about it. It's like he's trying to insert himself back into our lives when I've worked so hard to move on.

It's understandable that you would feel anger towards this situation. It sounds like you've made a lot of progress in healing and moving forward after the divorce. Have you considered discussing your concerns with the school or event organizers?

That's a good idea. I think I will reach out to them and let them know how uncomfortable this makes me. I deserve some peace and distance from my ex-husband, especially when it comes to my daughter's school events.

Absolutely, you have every right to prioritize your own well-being and set boundaries that make you feel comfortable. It may be helpful to express your concerns and discuss alternative options with the school, so they can understand your perspective. Remember, you are in control of how you navigate this situation.
You're right, I shouldn't just passively accept this without speaking up. I need to advocate for myself and my daughter. Thank you for reminding me of that.
You're welcome! It's important to stand up for yourself and your boundaries. If there's anything else I can do to support you, please don't hesitate to let me know.
